text: The room is dingy. Unkempt. The camera sits on the bed, o its side, facing the door. We can hear someone moving aro off screen. The door handle clicks; someone's trying it.    Then noth Then, suddenly, loud pounding on the door. Andrew's voice is scratchy and prone to cracking.   He sp with a rushed mix of fear and anxiety.
What do you want, I'm getting ready for school-
Why is the door locked, unlock this fucking door right now. The bed stirs as Andrew sits down.
I said unlock this door. UNLOCK THE DOOR. OPEN THE DOOR, NOW.
You're drunk-
Listen, you don't tell me- IF I'M
It's seven thirty. In the AM. You're drunk, dad, that's crazy-
What're you doing in there.
I'm filming this.
What?
I bought a camera. I'm filming all your shit from now on.
There's a beat, and then we can hear Mr. Detmer moving aw from the door.
Equally dingy. SANDRA DETMER, gaunt and sickly, is sat up bed. Andrew's filming her. She's clearly very ill, speaki in a weak rasp. Andrew now holds the camera.
Mom? Will you say hi to the camera?
Who's the audience?
The millions of people watching at home.
Hello world. Do I look awful?
No, you look great.
I've been looking a little better, yeah?
Oh yeah, definitely.
It's a nice camera.

Clark Street is a slummy mess; dead lawns, potholes in th street in a downtrodden suburb of Portland Oregon. Andrew carries the camera loosely at his side before getting int the passenger side of a car. In the driver's seat is MATT Garrety, 17, with messy hair He's disaffected, and more than a little cynical; the reasoned demeanor of an unpretentious high-school intellectual.
I got you egg salad.
Oh, yeah, thanks.
They're driving.
So...Should I ask about the camera, or-
I'm filming things now. I'm filming everything.
You're filming everything.
For my mom. I'm trying to get custody of her from my dad. She's getting worse, and he's not...helping, and this way, in case something goes down-
He gets violent or whatever-
Right, it'd be evidence.
Evidence. But you're not with him right now, but you're filming this.
Well, yeah, to add context.
Context.   Andrew, you are...a weird dude.
Did you ever read any Auguste Comte?
What is that?
He's this philosopher I'm reading.
For school?
He's just like- his whole thing is about being positive and like, taking up for yourself. You should read him, maybe, it might make you feel- you know, improve your outlook.
Yeah, right.
Andrew's getting out of the car, but then ducks back in t see Matt lighting a pipe.
Are you not coming in?
I'm gonna blaze a little first, yeah?
You're going to miss first period- Matt turns on the radio, loud.
Okay, okay.
Andrew's filming himself putting stuff in his locker, and does a quick sweep of the crowded school hallway.
This is my school, I guess.   This is the hallway-
Vote "Kaz!" A girl suddenly approaches, awkwardly handing Andrew a fl
Vote Steve Kazinsky for Senior class president!
...yeah-

Every vote counts. Andrew films the flyer for a moment, brightly colored and featuring a picture of a smiling Steve Kazinsky, before something yanks the camera away. For the first time we see ANDREW Detmer, 17, pale, awkwar and gangly, with long, stringy hair and thin, scraggly be He looks anxious, if not afraid.
Yo this camera is a piece of shit. It's like from 2004 or some shit. WAYNE, 17, big and hateable in his Ed Hardy T-shirt, appe wrapping his arm roughly around Andrew.
Hey, how do I look? (starts muscle posing) Like this? Ooh, that's good.   Like this? That's sexy, right?
Bryce, gimme my camera back-
Fuck you Andrew, shut up.   This camera's a piece of shit.
You got me, let's go. Wayne turns and knocks everything out of Andrew's locker. Bryce starts to walk away with the camera.
Hey, Bryce, come on, give it back- The camera is set down on the ground, and then abruptly kicked back to Andrew. He picks it up, checking on it.
(quietly, sad) Oh come on...
A view from the bleachers as the soccer team practices. T cheerleaders are practicing too. We cut: a different view lower.
This is where I eat lunch, out here on the bleachers.
The camera's next to Andrew as he's eating, down on the bench. A CHEERLEADER approaches.
Hi.
Hey-
Could you not videotape us, please? It's really fucking creepy.
I wasn't, videotaping you, so much as I was just-
Just don't videotape-              -you know, filming wha during the-
Don't videotape us, okay, or we'll call security. We see you watching us, we're not stupid, and it's sketchy, so back off.
...okay.
Is it on right now?
Yes.
Turn it off. Andrew turns off the camera.
Matt's driving.   Andrew's filming from the passenger sea
There's a party tonight.    A barn party at Haven Hills.
I thought Haven Hills was closed.
It's abandoned, yeah. That's why it's a good place for a party. Two kegs.
Why are you telling me?
You wanna go? I don't wanna go alone.
When was the last time you went to a party?
I don't like parties.
You're a senior.     Just come, you'll have fun.
I'll think about it.
Okay, right. Andrew, can I give you like, a pro tip?
Yeah?
Keep the camera at home.    It's weird.
It has a purpose-
I'm trying to be a good cousin, here. This is me being your friend, yeah? Okay?
Andrew is filming as he walks along towards his house.

Hey nice camera bitch, gimme your fuckin camera! The camera pans up to reveal HOWARD and COSTLY, moron hoodlums, along with several friends, over by a car on th other side of the road, drinking forties.

The fuck, fuck you faggot- Howard quickly starts crossing the street, and Andrew tur and runs back towards his house.
The camera lays on Andrew's bed again, filming the room. Andrew is on his laptop at a desk, working.
I'm uploading what I shot today...you have to keep a back-up, you know. The door suddenly opens, revealing MR. Adrian DETMER, 40s Andrew's father. He doesn't look as white trash as you'd expect.
Andrew looks up at him, and then goes back to working. Detmer goes over to Andrew and slaps him out of his chair
When I say open this door, you open this fucking door. Mr. Detmer leaves, slamming the door on his way out.   An sits on the floor in silence.
We're in Matt's car, driving on a dark dirt road, past an fence and rusted out farm equipment.
Are you sure it's here? (beat) Are you sure it's here, this all looks closed-
It's here, calm down.    Listen. We can faintly hear party music.
Oh yeah.

Cars are parked outside a big abandoned barn as Matt and Andrew approach. We see Christmas lights strung up, and there's clearly a party going on inside the barn. Kids ar milling about outside, too, drinking, fucking around.

What?
Don't follow me around all night, okay?
What am I supposed to do? I thought you said you didn't want to go alone-
Talk to people?   Have a beer, I don't know.

Andrew skulks around the party, which is clearly in full swing. Lots of bad footage of people talking, drinking, girls dancing sexy, guys joking around. Andrew is silent detached, just filming. He sees a girl, CASEY Letter, 16, filming as well. They shout over the music.

I have a video blog!   Why are you filming? Andrew simply backs away. More footage of the party. AUSTIN, 18, in an Ed Hardy shirt, comes out of nowhere. clearly a little drunk.
Hey, were you filming my girlfriend? Yes or no, were you filming my girlfriend?
No, I wasn't filming anyone specific, just filming the party.
(beat) Okay, good, because I don't wanna have to beat your ass.
Okay.
Don't talk back to me. Don't get smart, okay, I'm being nice here. I'm being nice to you.
(beat) Say okay.
Okay-

Cause I know you were filming my girlfriend dancing. I should break your fucking nose, you know that? You know that, I should beat your ass right now, but I'm trying to be nice. Fuck you. Austin abruptly throws his beer on Andrew, getting some o the camera, and then spits on him. Andrew backs up, shock lowering the camera.

Andrew's out alone in a field now, furiously cleaning the lens of the camera, obstructing our view. Cut to a few moments later; the camera now resting in his lap or on th ground. We can see the barn, the party still going on. After a few moments, we can faintly hear Andrew crying.
(loud, sudden) Are you Andrew?
(startled) What-

Are you Andrew-with-the-camera? (beat) Matt's cousin, Matt said you had a camera? The camera is picked up to reveal STEVE "Kaz" Kazinksy, 1 approachably handsome and in great shape, with an easygoi instantly likeable charisma. He's a little drunk and giddy.

I'm Steve Kazinsky-

I don't-

Steve is walking ahead in the field of tall grass, toward woods. It's rather dark.
Look, I don't think we're supposed to-
Is there a light on that?   On your camera?
Oh, I don't- Hm, I don't know- The camera goes down for a moment while Andrew futzes wit it. The light clicks on, illuminating Steve.
Awesome.
They've reached the woods, and Steve is climbing over the remains of a fence. The light bounces around wildly.
What were you guys doing out here? This is way out-
Me and your cousin were blazing a little.
Matt's out here?
A bunch of people were out here, but I think they've all gone back, now, cause we're like, obsessed with the thing.
The what?
They're in the woods now, thick and dizzying. It's near silent but their feet crushing the Fall leaves on the gro Steve walks out ahead.
Andrew Detmer, that's right.   I remember you from homeroom, Freshman year.
You remember that?
Yeah, I have a memory for faces. I'm gonna go into politics, which is ironic because I'm soooo fucking high right now- probably shouldn't be letting you videotape this-
I'm gonna be so rich when you're president, you have no idea-
Yeah, video footage of me luring you into the woods for gay sex- wait, hey- HEY, MATT, IS THIS IT?
Down here!

Matt? The camera turns to reveal Matt, standing next to some ki of craggy hole in the ground, at the base of a hill in th woods. It's big, but the darkness beyond is impenetrable the camera. It looks like a big black spot.

...It's like, whispering?
Listen.
Singing?

Andrew, hey, come on! Don't...shit.

-shouldn't have come in here.

Walking. Darkness. The cave is even tighter now. The ligh flickers, some kind of electrical disturbance, then goes completely We hear Andrew curse, fumbling with it, and th nightvision mode comes on.

Can you believe this, this is NUTS- The nightvision is turned off, revealing Matt. They've co into a larger chamber in the cave, one somehow lit from within; the boys are bathed in a softly pulsing turquoise glow. They speak loudly, clearly talking over something we can' hear.

My dad is actually a fireman, or was, I don't know. He got injured like two years ago, and now they just pay him out of, like, insurance. He doesn't do anything, I mean he goes out during the day, but I don't know where. He drinks a lot.

My mom has spinal meningitis, she's- she can't work or anything, and the insurance doesn't cover all of her medicine, so a lot of my money has to go into that. I figure if I get enough on camera, maybe I can, I dunno, get custody of her or something. Steve mulls this over.

Yeah?

...That's intense.

How-

Don't tell anybody about that-

No, I like braingina.   Braingina is the shiiiiit. Steve floats up a bunch of chips from his bag, and then r fires them into his mouth.

If anyone criticizes you, just call them a hater. It's like calling someone a racist, they'll just drop whatever they're complaining about and be like "I'M NOT A HATER." Nobody wants to be a hater.

blood-

You have to do at least one of your tricks for the camera, though.
I am so sick of being filmed, you have no idea, Casey-
No I know, but I'm not going to use any of this. I just want you to do a trick, one of your good ones.
When do your parents get back from Spain?
A week.
(beat) Okay, if you don't film me for one week-
Ahhhh-
One week, I'll show you my new trick. I guarantee you will shit bricks. Yeah?
...Ughhhh.
Matt's asleep in bed on a different day.   Casey's filmin from next to him.
(whispering) I'm filming you and you don't know. I'm terrible. I'm gonna show you this later and you're gonna be like "whaaaaaaaaaat!"
Matt runs out ahead of the camera, and does a little shuc and-jive boxer dance.
You ready?
I'm ready!
Are you sure-
Let's do it! Woo! Casey raises a paintball gun out ahead of the camera. She fires. Matt's arm whips out, impossible fast. He holds up the caught paintball.
(awed) Holy shit, Matt.
Casey fires several more shots, Matt catches them effortlessly, then hurls them all into the air. Mid-air, they all pop, some of the paint landing on the camera and Casey.
(laughing, awed) Matt, oh my god, oh my god!
It's dark; the camera turns on, then the light, revealing Matt, groggy, half awake.
What happened?
Ughhhh camera...I had that dream again.
Tell me.

It's like I'm...I'm not me, I'm something else. And I'm out in this...out in space. And stars are all around me, and I'm zooming past them; everything is really like three-D, I can see the shape of the stars. I'm looking for somewhere to sleep, or something, and I see earth, and I go down to earth. And then...I don't know, just the main part is that I'm out and there are the stars and they just look like millions of little points of light...And Steve is there.
Steve is there?
Yeah but he feels like he's not part of it. Like he's there separately, inside my head. Andrew is there too. I don't know. I'm worried about Andrew. (beat, slyly) Why don't you put the camera away?
Oh yeah? What's gonna happen to me if I put the camera away-
Oh I think you know. I think you know what's going down.
We could leave the camera on.
You arrrrreeee...C'mere. Matt advances on Casey, and the camera falls off to the s of the bed. We can hear her giggling, which is abruptly muffled by kissing.
The camera is aimed at Steve's tombstone. There are still flowers and memorials spread around. Some are rotting. Th camera moves around a little, then back to Steve's tombst

Screaming from Sandra's bedroom. The heater rattling. The TV from downstairs. There's a knock on the window. The camera is picked up, to reveal Matt floating outside, loo around nervously. After a moment, Andrew opens the window.
Matt stands fidgeting, clearly uncomfortable, as Andrew f him.
You haven't been returning my calls, so I thought I'd just...you know, ambush.
That's rude.
I just- I've been getting, you know, bad vibes or whatever. Andrew is silent.
I know you stopped coming to school, and my mom said you guys are having a lot of problems with money. I'm worried about you. 71.
Why?   Your life's great-
Dude, don't be like that, okay-
You don't need to worry about me. I'm stronger than ever now. I can lift a whole car by myself. I could fucking crush this entire house, I'm fine.
That doesn't- that actually sounds like the opposite of fine. Andrew, come on, let's get out of here, your room's a mess, it smells like a Denny's bathroom in here.
So what?
You're my cousin. You're my friend- it's my responsibility to take care of you.
I think you should go. I have to pick up my mom's medication.
...Are you going to break the rules? (beat) We're too strong now, Andrew. We're too strong for that. If you did that, you know I'd have to-
You'd have to what. You were always the weakest. You couldn't do shit to me.
...Andrew-
I'm not gonna break your stupid fucking rules, just fuck off and stay out of my life.

Matt stands staring at Andrew. The camera fidgets uncomfortably. Matt shakes his head, and the camera follo him as he goes to the window, gives Andrew one last look, then rockets off into the sky. The camera sits in silence, pointed at the window.
The camera approaches the counter.
Hello, how can I help you.
I'm here to pick up a prescription for Sandra Detmer.
Um, yes, hold on. That's Imuran, Baclofen, Glatiramer and Vicodin.
That's right.
Okay, and the copay on that is...Seven hundred and fifteen dollars, eighty three cents. Silence.
I have to come back.
Okay, we'll hold it for you.

Andrew is filming out his window, watching his father lea His stereo plays David Bowie. Once his dad's car is gone, Andrew sets down the camera on the dresser opposite the mirror, and leaves the room. Time passes, and Andrew reappears, now dragging a crate. opens it, and pulls out his father's fireman's uniform. W do short-space time cuts as he takes out the jacket, look it, and turns it inside out, so that the metallic firepro inner lining is exposed. "Ziggy Stardust" comes on Andrew's stereo.

Andrew, wearing the jacket, looks at himself in the mirro his back to the camera. He reaches down, and picks someth up, looking at it, then pulls it over his head. It's a gas mask. He stands there staring at the surreal, hard edged, facel figure in the mirror. Looks right. Looks left. Adjusts th mask. Then turns and whips out his hand; the camera is abruptly yanked across the room.

It's a run-down house in Andrew's neighborhood. The streetlights and the setting sun give everything light in yellow orange haze. Howard, Costly, and some other thugs are chilling on the porch, laughing loudly, smoking a blunt. They clearly haven't noticed Andrew, who's filming from out by the str He reaches down, and picks up a rock, then hurls it at th house. It flies up and breaks a window. Costly, Howard an the thugs immediately mobilize, swearing and posturing as they rapidly surround Andrew. He doesn't react.

You are about to get fucking stomped, you know that right? You hear me son? Come to my house, it's late, I don't see any fucking police officers or some shit, I don't know what you you think you're doing throwing shit at my house-
No, wait, what the fuck. What the fuck are you dressed up like that for. Are you high?
Lil' Andrew's straight up tripping right now, I don't even know, I'ma give your ass a wake up call- Howard starts towards Andrew, who raises a hand out in fr of the camera. He makes the "gun sign."
Oh you got a gat? I got a gat too bitch- Howard starts to pull a gun from the back of his pants.

(firing the finger gun) Bang. Howard's body abruptly FOLDS BACKWARDS with a sickly loud chorus of cracks, and then is FLUNG ASIDE. The thugs, shocked, don't have a second to react before Andrew telekinetically BLOWS ONE OF THEM BACKWARDS, sending him smashing headfirst through the windshield of his car. Costly and the remaining thug start running, and the remaining thugs legs suddenly flip up out from under him, breaking, bending and twisting like a rag doll, before he propelled face first into the ground, WHAM. Andrew launches into the air, coming down just in front o Costly, who skids to a halt.

-no, no- Costly is shoved to the street and ground back and forth though under the weight of a giant thumb, leaving a glistening smear of clothes, blood and skin, before he fa across the curb. We can hear the men screaming and groaning in agony, but other than that, the night is silent. Andrew raises a hand, and all of their wallets and loose money lift away from them, flying to him. There's a beat, and then Andrew launches into the air.

Andrew sits under one of the red airplane spotter lights one of the strut supports. The camera sits nearby, watchi the expressionless figure as it counts the money. There's a beat and he hangs his head. We can hear muffled noises of frustration from under the mask. Something that sounds like a low, angry scream. Very suddenly, he dives off the tower. A second later, th camera is yanked after him, zooming out into freefall.

Andrew, holding the camera, touches down just outside the station. He waits a beat, and then starts to walk towards it. We transition to... FROM GAS STATION SECURITY CAMERAS. Black and white, a slightly grainy feed, with no audio. We watch from the camera by the pumps as the bizarre figu in the coat and the gas mask, holding the camera out in f of it, strides past people pumping gas, into the station store.

The wall mounted security camera shows us the whole store Andrew enters, turning to the clerk behind the register, says something, looking concerned. He's suddenly blown ou of frame. After a beat, the register rips itself free from the coun and floats over to Andrew. Andrew turns and walks out, the register floating with hi as he does, a second clerk rushes out, panicked, yelling. goes behind the counter, and grabs a shotgun.

Andrew exits the gas station, as does the clerk, who yell raising the shotgun. Andrew whips an arm out towards him, and the clerk fires he's hit by a wave of energy. The shotgun blast goes wild striking the stacked tanks of propane next to the garage. The effect is instantaneous; a blinding white flash of fi envelopes the clerk and floors Andrew, the camera we look through jerking awkwardly, the feed breaking down. FROM ANDREW'S SECOND CAMERA. The camera lays awkwardly on its side, the distorted audi from its damaged microphone SUDDEN AND PIERCING. It's been flung a good deal away from Andrew, who lays motionless, burning.

The clerk is dead, and a nearby gas station customer is horribly injured and screaming. His gas pump lays on the ground, pumping out gas onto the asphalt. Andrew slowly shifts, unable to move properly, and forces himself to roll over. The fire on his body touches the fi on the asphalt, and spreads lightning fast to the gas pum The resulting explosion engulfs the entire station. The camera is spun violently out into the street-

The camera is color, with crackly, strange, somewhat distorted audio. The image is a little blown out. Andrew on a bed. His entire right side is absolutely scorched; the flesh looks like bloody, cracked paper, blackened and red. The parts of him that are bandaged are already soaked through with blood. He is barely breathing, hooked up to various machines. Andrew is not going anywhere anytime soon. This is ensure by the handcuff on his left wrist. The machines beep. Andrew doesn't move. The door opens, a Mr. Detmer enters, speaking to a POLICE DETECTIVE on the other side of the door.
-come down to the city, cause his mother's all alone right now. She's got MS, I had to leave her at the house all a fucking alone.
I understand, Mr. Detmer.
Shit. Jesus, look at this.   Can I have a moment with my son.
Yeah I- I'll be outside the door, yeah?

Okay. The officer closes the door, and Mr. Detmer goes and sits down in a chair next to the bed. He sits there staring at Andrew, clearly horrified and upset, and buries his head his hands. We SPEED UP THE RECORDING, and Detmer just sit like that. After five minutes of speed up, we slow down.
I want you to apologize to me. Andrew is comatose.
I said I want you to apologize to me. I know you can hear me. So I want you to sit up and apologize to me. I want you to stop this bullshit right now. Andrew is comatose.

Do you know how much this shit is going to cost me? Do you know what you've done to your family? (beat) You don't even care, do you? You just don't give a fuck, you've got your fucking morphine, don't you. There's a beat, and then Detmer suddenly slaps Andrew's b shoulder. Andrew flinches badly, and his pulse speeds up the monitor.

Stop it. I'm not buying this shit, you can't just play this off like a fucking (slap) Game, this is real. You really fucked me, me and your mother you know that, you little (slap) Shit. Andrew no longer flinches, but the slaps leave red, bleed molten welts. Detmer stands up, clearly upset, and takes quick pace forward and back.
Goddamn it, goddamn it!-

Detmer goes to slap Andrew again, and Andrew's arm jerks Mr. Detmer floats is telekinetically lifted into the air. He hangs screaming and struggling for a moment, then beco rigid. Andrew spreads his fingers, and his father abruptly separ into all of his component parts. They stop moving, hanging lifeless, then drop to the grou in a bloody mess. Andrew's eyes open, revealing black-red eightball hemorrhages, and he seizes badly, letting out a scream of agony, and then another, tearing at his IV. The police detectives rush the room, reacting with horror the gore that was Andrew's father. They barely have time scream out when Andrew snaps his cuff free of the bed, an lets out AN ENORMOUS CONCUSSIVE BLAST, blowing apart everything in the room including the camera.
All of Casey's family is present, along with lots of litt kids. Everyone's gathered around Casey's little brother, who's being presented with a birthday cake. Matt looks happy.
-appy birthday to you! Everyone let's out a cheer, including Casey, but then she notices Matt abruptly duck out. She follows him to the bathroom...
...where he's holding his nose, which is bleeding badly.
Matt-
Do you hear that, how can you not hear that?
In the background, we can hear the house phone ring.    T cell phones.
Matt, what hap-
The singing, how can you not hear that!? Something's wrong, okay, something's wrong with Andrew, or-
Matt, please, okay, you're scaring me, are you okay-
No, something's wrong, something's wrong. Matt pushes past her, running upstairs. Casey starts to follow, but then stops, lowering the camera.
Casey, you have to come in here.
Mom, Matt is-
Come in here right now.   Come in here right now.
Casey's filming the big screen TV, which is showing the n

-going to have a feed live on the scene in the second, we apologize for the delay but as of right now every news helicopter in the greater Multnomah County is headed to Portland- again, right now we have very little information, but the word is that the bombings started just over nine minutes ago, and haven't subsided yet, with- okay, here's the feed from NBC Chopper 5. We get a helicopter view from over downtown Portland, everything seems okay, and then something streaks by, crashing headlong into the side of a building.
The impact is like a wrecking ball, office furniture blow out into the air along with glass, steel and concrete, WH

Wait, that was- that was not a bomb- I repeat, not bombings, it's something else- The camera turns as Matt rushes down the stairs, now in h winter parka, his nose plugged with kleenex. We hear anot of those jarring, shattering impacts, and the camera goes back to the TV, revealing the big MADE IN OREGON sign in Town toppling down into the street.
I need your car.
What? Matt, look, what's happening, look at what's happening-
I see, I know, I have to go, okay-
Don't leave, don't leave me-
Give me your keys.
I- Matt-
Casey is chasing Matt across the lawn to her car, her voi filling with panic, the camera being held offhanded now, unimportant.
Please don't leave, don't go- We hear helicopters pass low overhead.
I have to go to the city.
I can't fly if there are all these helicopters in the air, I just have to drive there, or, listen, I have to figure this out, Andrew's in trouble. This is my fault.
Andrew?   What are you talking ab- Matt gets in the car and starts it.   Casey's breaking do openly crying now.
Matt please! MATT PLEASE, PLEASE

Casey's sitting shotgun as Matt drives. His face is unreadable. They're driving on the I-5. More helicopters. Downtown Portland is visible now, as are some fires. Casey is quietly crying, the camera held loosely in her l
This is all my fault.
No! No it isn't!   It isn't your fault! We hear and see the lights of ambulances and police cars they zoom past, but Casey keeps the camera on Matt.
Matt, it's not safe. It's not safe. What's going on. What's happening. Why are we doing this, Matt, please. Please take me home. You don't have your license, you can't drive without your license.

They're getting into downtown now. We can hear sirens. Casey is filming out the window, everything looks normal, until there's a loud crash; then Casey swishes the camera reveal that a police car, its siren still moaning, has la on top of a newstand, apparently dropped from the sky.

How- how is that possible, that's not possible- There's an explosion from nearby and shattered glass rain down onto the car. Matt slams on the brakes, looking up through the windshield, searching the sky.
Where are you, man? There's a beat, and then a police officer abruptly appear the passenger's side, next to Casey.

Listen, you can't be here, I need you to turn this car around right now and- The police officer is yanked upwards, disappearing from s for a moment before coming crashing down thirty feet away Casey screams.

What's...What is...What's...Matt please, please- The car SUDDENLY ROCKETS INTO THE AIR, straight up, flipp end over end, past the tops of the buildings, and then co to a stop, hanging at about two hundred feet. Casey's breathing is painfully short and sharp. Matt stares out i the night sky. He flicks on the brights. There's Andrew, in his hospital gown, floating a dozen feet out, his flesh charred and twisted, his body clearly wracked with agonizing pain. A news helicopter circles past out of sight, and for a moment, Andrew is framed in the chopper's spotlight. His eyes flash to the car.
(screaming)
The windshield is TORN OUT, and seconds later MATT IS RIP OUT OF THE CAR AS THOUGH YANKED BY A GIANT HOOK, taking h seatbelt with him.
No NO NO

The car goes into freefall, no longer important to Andrew plummeting down, down, down. Casey's screams are barely audible over the rushing of the wind as the buildings rus past outside, her camera frozen in place as she plummets her death. And then suddenly, so suddenly it's completely disorienti the side of the car bursts apart and we're flying, blurre views of buildings, the sky, the side of some jeans... Stillness. Casey's camera is pointed down, showing her adidas...and Matt's high-tops.
Stay here, okay? You have to stay here.
(barely coherent) You can fly?
Stay here.     I have to talk to Andrew.
Matt..what...
Casey, I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. Matt's feet suddenly go out of frame.

Matt wait!     WAIT PLEASE!   MATT! NOTE: In the following sequence, everything is seen in glimpses and glances, never lingering too long on one thi Much of what happens should be seen through implication, rather than direct effect. Everything happens very fast, and none of the cameras can fully keep track. FROM SEVERAL HELICAMS. The feed is crisp and clear, but without the satellite au meaning no narration from the reporter. There are several chopper's flying at different distances from the action, we intercut as necessary.

The news chopper at first shows Casey's destroyed car lay in the street, then pans back up to show Andrew, who's floating hunched over, vomiting. Matt flies up behind him, and tries to help him, but Andr shoves him away. We're too far away to hear anything that said. Matt tries again, and Andrew yells something. Matt, clear upset, replies. Andrew, talking fast and jerky, gestures towards his burns. Matt tries to reply several times, but Andrew isn't hearing it. Matt smiles nervously at the destruction, and says something gently. Andrew replies, and whatever is said here, it causes a radical shift in Matt's demeanor. He's no longer concerne he seems repulsed. Andrew says more, clearly SCREAMING at Matt. Matt seems to beg Andrew for something and Andrew relents Matt continues, more forcefully, and then notices somethi to his right. A BUS SMASHES HIM OUT OF THE AIR, SWATTING LIKE A BUG INTO THE SIDE OF AN APARTMENT COMPLEX. Andrew suddenly turns, flailing an arm at us in the chopp a mailbox comes CRASHING UP INTO THE CAMERA. FROM MICHAEL ERNESTO'S CAMERA. MICHAEL ERNESTO is, along with several other people from building, out on his roof. He watches in horror as the helicopter Andrew hit goes out of control, falling out of frame. Moments later, we hear the explosion as it crashes.
Oh, oh no, those people, man, those people, oh god-
Where's the other guy?

He's fucking dead man, you saw- oh shit oh shit- Andrew comes toppling down out of the sky like a wounded bird, crashing into the roof. He vomits again, mostly bil everyone around him is in shock, frozen, as he screams in pain and rolls over.
He's bleeding badly from the nose and ears.

(agonized, crying) No one's gonna help me...No one's gonna help me now... We get some shots from other people's cameras, video phon etc on the roof. Some people scream and try to run past Andrew, and he blasts them off the roof like bowling pins which leads to more screaming. Andrew stands shakily, looking directly at Michael Ernest
Please man, please, I don't know you man-
(mumbled) What type of camera is that?

(breaking down) What? I don't know, I don't know you man, I didn't- please okay, please- Andrew starts to raise an arm, when he's suddenly NAILED MATT, blasting by at well over eighty miles an hour. FROM BANK SECURITY CAMERA. The inside of the bank is quiet and peaceful, when MATT A ANDREW COME CRASHING THROUGH THE ROOF. FROM POLICE CAR DASHBOARD CAM. The police car rockets up the street, but has to screech halt when MATT AND ANDREW COME EXPLODING OUT OF THE FRONT THE BANK. The two of them brawl in the street for a moment; it's no impressive martial arts, or even super powered, just two fighting for their lives. Matt gets the upperhand, deckin Andrew and driving him to the ground, and suddenly the co car (our POV), lifts off. WE GO FLYING INTO MATT, crashing out the camera as he tur and creates a telekinetic wall.

CALA, filming from her apartment window, watches in shock horror as the police car, carried by its momentum, is sen FLIPPING INTO THE AIR, and we glimpse it as it passes her window, lights still flaring. Her sister rushes up, looking out the window.
Sissy stay away from the window!
What's happening what's happening-
They're right out there fighting! They're- Andrew and Matt come BLASTING UP THROUGH THE FLOOR IN THE

text: The two boys come smashing up through the roof of the apartment building. Andrew flies low, and Matt gives chas Andrew turns, beginning to telekinetically lob everything street level at Matt; traffic lights, parking meters, tre etc... ...But Matt's too good a flyer. What he doesn't block he simply dips and weaves around. Andrew, clearly still wooz is distracted and smashes into a street-light, wiping out the asphalt.

They're down. One of them just went down. Jesus christ. Matt slowly lands nearby. The camera zooms in and hits th both with a spotlight, causing Matt to shield his eyes an look up, scared, as Andrew struggles to stand. We get a good look at the toll this is taking on him; Mat face is a crimson mask of blood from his nose, eyes, mout and ears. He's limping badly, his clothes torn, visibly covered with injuries. He looks like he's been in a car wreck.
Oh shit, look at him.

He approaches Andrew, talking again, more fervently. Andr just shakes his head, falling repeatedly as he tries to stand, like a wounded dog. Two cop cars skid to a halt nearby, the officers unloadin and taking cover. One of them advances on Matt and Andrew gun raised. Matt goes out in front of Andrew, protective, pleading, raising his hands. The cop is clearly panicked. He fires a shot.    Matt's a whips out, impossible fast; he buckles and screams in pai holding his hand, which is gushing blood. Matt falls, screaming, and Andrew stands. officers backwards.

OH SHIT!   Oh jesus christ! Andrew approaches Matt, screaming and looking absolutely terrifying. Matt turns and ROCKETS OFF INTO THE SKY, Andr following a second later, tackling Matt out of the air. FROM KPR-PORTLAND'S LIVE-ON-THE-SCENE. We're at street level in downtown, people are absolutely everywhere, wandering out into the street, baffled, scare and looking for answers. A FIELD REPORTER fixes herself, preparing to speak.

Are we...Okay, yeah, gimme- two, one- We're live on the scene on Parson Boulevard just south of the center of downtown, and- There's a rushing, screeching sound from around the corne The camera jerks, and moves towards the corner, the camer man running to see what the sound is.

Shawn, wait, you're unplugged. Shawn- Something around the corner explodes, and Matt comes flyi past overhead, slightly on fire, before Andrew comes lung at Matt, catching him, twisting out and over the camera m SLAMMING HIM INTO THE SIDE OF A SKYSCRAPER ON THE STREET. Andrew lifts Matt up high into the air, scraping him agai buildings on either side of the street, bouncing like a pinball until-

-Matt struggles, and there's a visible ripple in the air; massive concussive burst, sending both of them rocketing downwards as though shot out of a cannon. They strike the massive bronze statue of "Portlandia," a trident wielding demigoddess, in front of the Michael Gra building, uprooting it from its pedestal before crashing the ground. Matt's body accordions brutally when he lands, and he flo down at a broken, dead angle. Andrew lands nearly as badl lays still for a moment, and then begins twitching and screaming when the chopper's spotlight hits him.

head_text.subj: FROM MICHAEL GRAVES' BUILDING EXTERIOR SECURITY CAMERA

text: The statue of Portlandia lays awkwardly in the street. Andrew writhes. Matt is motionless, blood pooling around him, his back broken.

head_text.subj: FROM POLICE DASHBOARD CAMS, HELICOPTER CAMERAS, HANDHELDS

text: A bunch of squad cars and emergency units converge around front of the Michael Graves building and downed statue. M and Andrew's bodies are painted by spotlights as police a news helicopters hang overhead. Police unload en-mass, guns out, immediately forming a perimeter and pushing in. We're with them as they approac the mood is of barely controlled panic, officers shouting back and forth to each other. Andrew and Matt are polka-dotted by red-laser sight dots. Andrew suddenly stands up, and several officers fire; the bullets spark off an invisible barrier in front of him, a he shakily raises both hands. The all of the police officers, firemen and paramedics ar telekinetically lifted into the air. They hang struggling for a moment, and then all of their limbs go rigid. We've seen this before. Andrew screams, and then...It all happens in under two seconds:

Matt swings an arm, blinding fast; the triton wielding ar Portlandia bends jaggedly, bringing down the pitchfork ha first through Andrew, then into the pavement. Andrew stands impaled, a look of shock on his face, and t Matt flails up his hand; the bullet lodged inside fires o striking Andrew in the head, killing him instantly. All of the floating people drop, dazed. Matt collapses.   After a moment, the police advance.

The clean room cams are incredibly hi-def, crisp and clea with all manner of data and time codes scrolling all over top and bottom of the screens. Matt lays on the floor of a perfectly white room. At the end is a blackened out two way mirror. There's a camera o the inside of this too, and we can see resolute men in su reflected on the inner glass, watching with unreadable expressions. There is a chair and a table, but he's clearly fallen out the chair. It's maybe an hour after the scene in front of the Michael Graves building, and he's received no medical attention. To this end, Matt is suffering from, among other things, massive blood-loss, multiple broken bones, dozens of gash and cuts, presumed internal bleeding, and a broken back. He can barely move, sliding around on the floor in his ow blood as he dies, watched by the compassionless eyes of t cameras. He is barely coherent, screeching in agony.

Please...Help me. Help me, HELP ME, please...I'm sorry! I'm so sorry, I tried- help me, help me, I'm dying, I'm dying. Stars- I see stars, somebody- It hurts, please. I'm- the blood...I tried... Two men in contamination suits enter the room, wielding s kind of radiation sensors. They go over to Matt, scanning him.
Listen, help me, help me. I'm dying, you have to help me, don't just let me- PLEASE I'M SORRY! I'm
The men ignore him as Matt makes some gasping sounds, his eyes going wide.

I can...I can hear the singing. Matt entirely stops moving.   He lays there, not breathin completely still. And then suddenly the two men are flung backwards, as is table and the chair. There are a series of grotesque popp and snapping sounds from Matt's body, and he jerks, and writhes, pushing himself up onto his hands and knees. The security cams track and zoom, and as Matt stands, we realize a startling truth: his cuts are closing themselve His broken bones have already molded back into place. His bruises are shrinking away to nothing. The blacked out glass suddenly shatters, and falls out of frame, revealing a shocked, frightened room of high ranki military personnel, along with several men in civilian clothes. Matt stares at them.   They stare back at him.
(terrified) Listen...Son, you don't- I mean... Matt raises a finger to his lips, and the general trails Matt smile weakly for a moment, then stops.
Would you please...turn off the fucking cameras.

We see a variety of international reporters covering a breaking story, but only see little clips of each, in multiple languages. Behind them are various shots of a hu hydroelectric dam in South Korea.

-expected to burst at any moment- City officials blame the malfunctions on the terrorist bombing that occurred at the dam's control center last March.- Botched evacuation has left thousands of the Kyo-lee Valley's residents trapped, with only one major roadway leading in or out. A roadway that has not been repaired in over ten years- Again, the scale here is just unprecedented. Our hearts are with people of Kyo-Lee tonight. FROM KIM HAI-SU'S CAMERA.

Kim Hai-Su, 17, is behind the camera filming his father, as his father hurries to gather his things into a duffle. Kim Hai-Su's younger brother, 8, wanders into the room, crying loudly, and Kim's father screams at him to put dow the camera.
They're in the car, driving fast through town. All around can see people panicking, and we see two cars collide on road up ahead.

They pull up onto an on-ramp, and are immediately trapped into gridlocked, dead-end traffic. Kim Hai-Su's father begins shrieking, and banging on the dashboard, which triggers his younger brother crying again. Kim shouts to calm down.
Kim is climbing out of the car; people all around are get out of their cars, hopelessly trapped. Someone screams, a Kim turns to reveal an enormous dam several miles away.

Rubble is falling off the side of an gigantic crack, whic splits further. Kim yells in fear. The crack widens, an enormous tidal gush of water bursts through, gushing down side of the hills into the valley.
